response:
Left relative afferent pupillary defect and reduced visual acuity localise to a left optic nerve lesion, while gait ataxia, right-sided limb dysmetria and dysdiadochokinesia with gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus and limb hypotonia are best explained by predominantly cerebellar pathology, most parsimoniously involving both cerebellar hemispheres (right more than left).

lesion_locations = ["left optic nerve", "bilateral cerebellar hemispheres"]
